intro: Stylobasium lineare, commonly known as the linear leaf stylobasium, is a member of the family Acanthaceae. It is a herbaceous plant characterized by its slender, upright stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. Stylobasium lineare is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa and Asia. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded or semi-shaded environments.
